description: A simple breakfast featuring fried eggs paired with spicy Middle Eastern shatta sauce.
ingredient: [{"name": "eggs", "units": null, "amount": 2}, {"name": "vegetable oil", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 2}, {"name": "shatta sauce", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 2}, {"name": "salt", "units": null, "amount": null}, {"name": "pepper", "units": null, "amount": null}, {"name": "bread", "units": "(for serving)", "amount": null}]
step_by_step: ["Heat a small frying pan with the oil until hot.", "Break in each egg and fry for 2-3 minutes until crisp around the edges and the white is set, but the yolks still runny.", "Remove the eggs from the pan and place on a plate.", "Dot the shatta sauce around and over the eggs and then season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.", "Serve hot with plenty of bread on the side."]

notes: Experiment with additional garnishes like cherry tomatoes, labneh, feta cheese, fresh herbs, saut√©ed mushrooms, or chickpeas.
